abstract.text: Choose a font family for Apple News Format that’s supported in iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Fonts determine the look of text in your article. Within font families, the properties

provide variations on the font for bolder or lighter, condensed or expanded, and regular or italicized text. To specify a font variant in Apple News Format, you can also use an explicit font variant’s PostScript name (listed in parentheses) in a
). For information about using fonts in Apple News Format, see
The following table lists font families for Apple News Format that are supported in iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.
Some font families may not support all unicode values.

content.text: Apply the Fonts to Your Article

inlineContent.text: The following example code shows how to apply the Arial font family to your article.

abstract.text: Design, create, and publish signature content for Apple News.
Define and apply custom, default, and inline text styles, or use HTML tags or Markdown syntax to style your text.
Learn about text styles and how to apply them to your text and text components.
Get Apple News Format reference information, and create signature content for Apple News.
The object for defining the style for a text component, including spacing, alignment, and drop caps.
The object for defining the drop cap text style to use in the first paragraph in a text component.
The object for applying text styling when not using HTML or Markdown formatting.
The object for defining the style for bulleted or numbered lists in an article.
The object for defining the text style, such as font family, size, and color, that you can apply to ranges of text.
